awd_titl_txt: STTR Phase I:  Real-Time Smart Data Lake
awd_abstract_narration:
The broader impact of this Small Business Technology Transfer (STTR) Phase I project will be to fundamentally accelerate the pace of data science. New solutions that alleviate or bypass the bottlenecks inherent in existing data analytics technologies are required to unlock the value contained in “big data” and bring greater benefits to research, business, and society at large.  The potential benefits include improved quality control for manufactured goods, reduced fraud in financial transactions, and enhanced customization of consumer services.  Many common software applications, such as search engines, online shopping, e-commerce, medical applications, and social networks, are backed by data analytical processing services. This project will enable massive data sets to be pre-processed directly by a shared storage service, then allow this capability to be efficiently utilized by client analytic applications. This project will accelerate transformation of analytical data to useful insights while reducing network congestion, simplifying complex analytics systems, and lowering information technology costs.
 
This Small Business Technology Transfer (STTR) Phase I project examines the challenge of how to dramatically accelerate data-intensive computing problems by enabling large data objects to be processed directly in the storage layer then efficiently utilized by client applications. The technology will be built on a software defined data lake used for big data applications. Key technology will be added to enable JSON, one of the most widely used data interchange formats, to be processed in a distributed manner in-place within this storage solution with the objective of enabling client analytic applications to retrieve not the complete object but only the desired subset of content they require. The storage solution will be augmented to transform the data into a format that can be directly consumed by the clients. This will substantially increase efficiency within the storage itself and between analytics clients and the storage solution – while acceelrating data processing by bypassing bottlenecks. The result will be a smart data lake that can reduce network traffic, improve data freshness, and enable real-time operation – while accelerating big data analytics by an order of magnitude or more.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Technology, Innovation, and Partnerships

por.por_cntn:
AirMettle is developing a real-time smart data lake solution that simplifies big data analytics and accelerates processing by an order of magnitude, or more. 

Companies and public sector services alike increasingly depend on gathering and analyzing data to manufacture higher quality goods, provide better services, identify potential problems, provide proactive maintenance, and much more. AirMettle is developing solutions that can improve the speed and efficiency of many modern digital services by enabling data to be analyzed much faster and more cost effectively. 

Modern Information Technology architectures separate the storage of data from the systems that process the data, enabling each to be independently optimized and scaled. Large data objects are generally split into a number of parts that are spread across a fleet of storage systems. The first step in analyzing data involves extracting the relevant content from the storage for subsequent processing by analytics applications. This task, while seemingly straightforward, can consume 80% or more of the time to insight. 

In an age where a phone or even a wristwatch contains more processing power than was available to land people on the surface of the moon, the AirMettle team wanted to unlock the capabilities of the data storage systems to help accelerate data analysis. The NSF Phase I STTR project just completed by AirMettle has made this vision possible for both data stored in CSV format using the most common compression technique (GZIP), as well as JSON-formatted data ? the most commonly used format for computer logs. 

The AirMettle team developed solutions that accelerate the processing of large CSV and JSON-formatted data objects at exceptionally high speed in a massively parallel distributed manner. Our partners at the University of Wisconsin-Madison (UW-Madison) developed tools that can utilize these capabilities while retaining all the power of modern higher-level analytics systems. The resulting AirMettle solution provides this functionality through open application programming interfaces (API) that are already broadly in commercial use today.

Intellectual Merit

This project enabled, for the first time, GZIP compressed data to be stored efficiently in a distributed storage service and analyzed at high speed directly from storage while using existing APIs. The AirMettle and UW-Madison teams demonstrated that large data sets can be stored in an efficient manner and directly analyzed without the need for traditional data warehouse solutions. We also demonstrated significant additional performance improvements by enabling the storage service to translate the data requested by analytics applications into a format that can be directly processed when it arrives. Further, we optimized a pushdown-based data processing engine that combines the benefits of pushdown processing and caching at fine granularity that can accelerate basic analytics operations by more than 2x. We also developed a pushdown-aware cache replacement policy to further boost performance compared to conventional analytics approaches. The combination of all these results confirms that users gain more value from data assets by leveraging systems such as AirMettle that utilize massively parallel processing at the storage layer to enhance performance and lower operational costs.

Broader Impacts

This project significantly extended the state-of-the-art in processing semi-structured data by enabling valuable preprocessing in the storage itself. As data-rich Artificial Intelligence/Machine Learning-driven applications come to dominate commercial environments, accelerating data analysis, reducing network congestion, lowering costs, and decreasing system complexity in the ways provided by the new AirMettle solution will be extremely attractive to enterprises across many sectors. Accelerating big data analysis by 10x to 100x will provide significant business advantage, energize scientific research where enormous data sets are involved, and increase efficiency within finance and other public sectors, directly benefiting society. Because of its software-defined storage nature, AirMettle offers these benefits in a highly flexible, easily deployable solution, allowing it to provide great benefit sooner, at lower cost and with less disruption.

 

 

 


Last Modified: 09/18/2022
Modified by: Donpaul C Stephens
